result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Sabala IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.
Consecutive to: Case 21CM1479

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety. Parenting class. Obtain and maintain full-time employment and/or schooling. No contact with victim G.M.R. unless victim agrees and approved by agent. Do not drive unless properly licensed.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Court order for intoxicated driver assessment and driver safety plan.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due. Collections may include income assignment. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Sabala IV

records.addlTxt:
10:43 AM Defendant Nicholas A Sabala IV in court.  Attorney  McKenna Quinter for Attorney William A Demet in court for Nicholas A Sabala IV.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Case 21CM1479
Plea - Ct. 2: GUILTY
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY. Cts. 1, 3 and 4 are dismissed but read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 9 months Racine County Jail; imposed and stayed for 18 months of probation.

Conditions of Probation:
Absolute Sobriety;
Parenting class; 
Full-time employment and/or schooling
No contact with victim G.M.R unless victim agrees and approved by agent;
AODA 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA surcharge.

Case 22CM513
Plea - Cts. 1 and 2: GUILTY
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY. Cts. 3 and 4 are dismissed but read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 9 months Racine County Jail each count; imposed and stayed for 18 months of probation; Each count to run concurrent to one another but consecutive to case 21CM1479, if Revoked.

Conditions of Probation:
Absolute Sobriety;
Parenting class; 
Full-time employment and/or schooling
No contact with victim G.M.R unless victim agrees and approved by agent;
Do not drive unless properly licensed;
AODA 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA surcharge.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:58 AM Defendant Nicholas A Sabala IV in court.  Attorney William A Demet in court for Nicholas A Sabala IV.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense makes statements on the record. Defendant is seeking a court appointed attorney in case 22CM513. Ready to resolve case 21CM1479.
State puts global offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:00 AM Defendant Nicholas A Sabala IV in court.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney William A Demet in court for Nicholas A Sabala IV. Court Reporter: Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense is seeking another status conference. Has not yet been appointed in this case. 
State does not object.
BTC: Matter set over
Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified public records w/o extrinsic evidence
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive unless properly licensed.

2:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas A Sabala IV appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Nicholas A Sabala IV. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Defense indicates the complaint does not list any prior OARs.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
